item.title: Julie add a quote by John Crowley
item.description: "It occurred to him that seeing a woman's child is like seeing a woman naked, in the way it changes how her face looks to you, how her face becomes less the whole story." -- John Crowley

item.title: Julie add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Julie add a quote by Richard Feynmann
item.description: "Study hard what interests you the most in the most undisciplined, irreverent and original manner possible." -- Richard Feynmann

item.title: Julie add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Julie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Julie add a quote by Eleanor Clark
item.description: "You are eating the sea, that's it, only the sensation of a gulp of sea water has been wafted out of it by some sorcery, and you are on the verge of remembering you don't know what, mermaids or the sudden smell of kelp on the ebb tide or a poem you read once, something connected with the flavor of life itself..." -- Eleanor Clark

item.title: Julie add a quote by Matt Groening
item.description: "Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come." -- Matt Groening

item.title: Julie add a quote by Stephen Hawking
item.description: "We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special." -- Stephen Hawking

item.title: Julie add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "So everything is necessary. Every least thing. This is the hard lesson. Nothing can be dispensed with. Nothing despised. Because the seams are hid from us, you see. The joinery. The way in which the world is made. We have no way to know what could be taken away. What omitted. We have no way to tell what might stand and what might fall." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Julie add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "Most people think that shadows follow, precede or surround beings or objects. The truth is that they also surround words, ideas, desires, deeds, impulses and memories." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Julie add a quote by gertrude stein
item.description: "it is nice that nobody writes as they talk and that the printed language is different from the spoken otherwise you could not lose yourself in books and of course you do you completely do." -- gertrude stein

item.title: Julie add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Julie add a quote by Charles Schultz
Julie add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "I was reading the dictionary. I thought it was a poem about everything." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Roland Barthes
item.description: "Language is a skin: I rub my language against the other. It is as if I had words instead of fingers, or fingers at the tip of my words. My language trembles with desire." -- Roland Barthes

item.title: Julie add a quote by Georges Perec
item.description: "Question your tea spoons." -- Georges Perec

item.title: Julie add a quote by Georges Perec
item.description:
"What we need to question is bricks, concrete, glass, our table manners, our utensils, our tools, the way we spend our time, our rhythms. To question that which seems to have ceased forever to astonish us. We live, true, we breathe, true; we walk, we go downstairs, we sit at a table in order to eat, we lie down on a bed on order to sleep. How? Where? When? Why?
Describe your street. Describe another. Compare." -- Georges Perec

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Julie add a quote by Juliet Cook
item.description: "I once typed 'vagina dentata' into dictionary.com and it asked me, 'Did you mean giant anteater?" -- Juliet Cook

item.title: Julie add a quote by Dean Young
item.description: "A poem should be odd as a small cast-iron platypus." -- Dean Young

item.title: Julie add a quote by C.D. Wright
item.description: "Poetry is the language of intensity. Because we are going to die, an expression of intensity is justified." -- C.D. Wright

item.title: Julie add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "They say that 'home is where the heart is.' I think it is where the house is, and the adjacent buildings." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Julie add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "My body is but the lees of my better being." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Julie add a quote by Charlie Kaufman
item.description: "Constantly talking isn't necessarily communicating." -- Charlie Kaufman

item.title: Julie add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "In every queen there's a touch of floozy." -- E.B. White

item.title: Julie add a quote by David Rowe
item.description: "If you can't beat em: Poem." -- David Rowe

item.title: Julie add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"When it's over, I want to say: all my life I was a bride married to amazement.
--from WHEN DEATH COMES" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Julie add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "You can have the other words-chance, luck, coincidence, serendipity. I'll take grace. I don't know what it is exactly, but I'll take it. " -- Mary Oliver
